results.title: Circular and non-circular nearly horizon-skimming orbits in Kerr spacetimes

main_text_sample.first_500:
The space-based gravitational-wave detector LISA  will be a unique tool to probe the nature of supermassive black holes (SMBHs), making it possible to map in detail their spacetimes. This goal is expected to be achieved by observing gravitational waves emitted by compact stars or black holes with masses [MATH: \mu \approx 1 -
100\,M_\odot] spiraling into the SMBHs which reside in the center of galaxies  (particularly the low end of the galactic center black hole mass function, [MATH: M \approx 1
